title: Take a break in Manhattan
content:
Okay, you’re at your computer working on Glyphs or Designing something and you’ve just had your 12th cup of coffee and nothing is going right. Stop. Push yourself away from the computer get your field glasses and head to Central Park. Go to the Ramble and look for the Fall Warbler Migration. From about the beginning of August to mid October the Warblers will be coming through Manhattan with the peak in mid to late September.

 [‹ Another internship question...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119152617/http:/typophile.com/node/14690 "Go to previous forum topic") [inciting incidents and specimens - what began your type fixation? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119152617/http:/typophile.com/node/14398 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Dan Weaver

comments.content:
And switch from coffee to tea, man.

hhp

I already have, about 3 years ago. No more caffine except what there is in Morrocan Mint. I have a friend who told me that there are phytochemicals in tea that counteract caffine. All I know is I don’t have nervious hands and I don’t have highs and crashes in my blood sugar anymore.
